headline: Ehhh
pros: Only giving it 2 stars because the team I worked with was amazing. Good benefits and paid time off. If you're lucky enough to have a good team in upper management then you're all set, but. I was one of the unfortunate.
cons: Not sure if it was just the particular area I worked under but no upper management wanted to take ownership of policies that caused issues with customers. NO support offered if understaffed which was often because turnover rate was like 90%. Just because we were CONSTANTLY understaffed didn't mean we got more help or guidance even without a manager. A lot of it you have to figure out on your own which is fine but then upper management would still have the same expectations like if we were a fully staffed branch which was EXTREMELY stressful. I would say if your work here, do not take any lead roles. As a regular teller it is so much better. Albeit, it could've just been my area (Greater LA Area). Managers have so much on their plate, they're constantly stressed, no accountability for verbal instructions. eg. If upper management would express that certain things needed to be done, if anything went wrong they would say that if it's not on "The Source" then it shouldn't have been done; which is complete bollocks. Honestly, just look out for yourself. I've never been happier to leave a job. Not worth the immense stress. Lastly, they expect employees to perform duties outside of their job function with absolutely no compensation.

headline: If you enjoy excel and late evenings this is for you.
pros:
-Team work atmosphere 
-Helpful co workers
-Company as a whole cares about health of its employees
-Reasonable vacation time and floating holidays
-Semi-Flexible Schedule (2-3 days per week are flexible you can work 10-5)
-You can usually begin your day between 9:00am and 11:30pm.
-Repetitive work
-Down time through out the week
-Great office amenities
-Fast paced 2 to 3 times per week.
-Enclosed offices available for short amounts of time in office when at full capacity.
-Unlimited coffee/tea, free in office gym membership, free parking
-No weekends!
-Paid overtime
-You do not have to take sick/vacation time for mid day appointments, errands, inconveniences/emergencies. (sick kids) You can flex your schedule to get your 40 hours in.
-Diverse
-Offer lots of workshops/courses/classes/ways to improve and expand skills. Not only through an online portal/website but also through seminars provided by the company
-"No zoom Fridays"
-Gain experience in UAT testing
cons:
-This department does not participate in all US Holidays, therefore you will work every Thanksgiving and all other US Holidays that fall on a business day. -Fast paced evenings with Daily/Weekly/Monthly Deadlines.
-Two to three late evenings per week. 1 to 2 assigned days (Mon, Tues, Wed, Friday) will end when you complete your work and it is approved by the client. (7:00pm to 9:00pm) Thursdays and every Month end business day require mandatory OT. Those days end between 9:30pm to 3:00am. 
-If you have children with evening activities or family gatherings often, do not count on attending. 
-Office desks are right next to each other, no privacy, no trash cans at desks, not all desks are stand up/sit down (people may bicker over them)
-Usually this department and departments close-by are short staffed.
-If you take a day off during a long week, you will not be paid time and a half for ALL of your OT. (Most companies have rules similar but I find it unfair.)
-Columbus branch does not have extended room for growth compared to Chicago or Tampa offices.
